ygData.subject: Re: armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Me personally?  I m a 18th level wiz dark elf.  That s why I am limited to wearing cloth types.. I do have a goss robe myself and was just speaking to other
ygData.messageBody:
Me personally? I'm a 18th level wiz dark elf. That's why I am limited to
wearing cloth types.. I do have a goss robe myself and was just speaking to
other items than robes there. I have a damask item, woven items and a
netted piece too. That is why I mentioned them, but I couldn't recall
where they were picked up other than the damask wrist piece because I just
got that in Najena a couple days ago. I'm too lazy and not scrolling back
through all these emails to see what the other person was or if they
mentioned it, because I'm going back to sleep!


At 11:39 AM 6/25/99 +0200, you wrote:
>From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>
>
>According to Cristie:
> > You can get some woven armor or damask... we pretty much have to stick to
> > cloth types but they are much better for certain. I think we are able to
>
>I have to assume you're human.
>
>A marginal improvement over your cloth might be had by hunting frogloks
>in the sewers. Frogloks have netted armor, which is exactly the same as
>cloth, but as light or lighter as small sizes - thus you can scrap 1 or
>2 units of weight. Probably not worth the bother. It wasn't for me: I'm
>high elf, and thus able to wear small size.
>
>After this, you must relocate to Freeport. Woven armor is gotten out of
>Frogloks too, but you must go down to the Innothule Swamp and their home
>of Upper Guk for this. Woven is about equivalent to patchwork, and can
>be worn by all races & classes, and is light.
>
>Damask is from Najena mostly, equivalent to leather, and limited to casters.
>It's a tad too high level for you now, I think.
>
>Then you have Gossamer, which is high level stuff :)
>
>--
